item.title: Appeal Issue
item.dc:creator: @Derek123 Derek123
item.description:
@Derek123 wrote:

[code]sendQuest("@whi@Appeal Mod", 5951);
sendQuest("@whi@Close Appeal", 5952);
sendQuest("@red@Moderator Appealing", 5985);
sendQuest("@whi@", 5966);
sendQuest("@red@You , “+playerName+”, are appealing for a moderator …", 5967);
sendQuest("@whi@", 5968);
sendQuest("@whi@Put The Person’s Username Here!:", 5983);

sendQuest("@whi@Then click on a rule that they have broken", 5969);
sendQuest("@red@Please don’t do false reports.", 5970);[/code]

Thats my appeal code currently.

I removed //sendQuest("@whi@1 . Offensive Language", 5971); //sendQuest("@whi@2 . Scamming ", 5972); //sendQuest("@whi@3 . Password Scamming ", 5973); //sendQuest("@whi@4 . Macroing ", 5974); //sendQuest("@whi@5 . Advertisng ", 5975); //sendQuest("@whi@6 . Harrassment ", 5976); //sendQuest("@whi@7 . Asking For Personal Details ", 5977); //sendQuest("@whi@8 . Annoying", 5978); //sendQuest("@whi@9 . Spamming", 5979); //sendQuest("@whi@10 . Asking for mod/admin", 5980); //sendQuest("@whi@When you can't say level ,", 5981); //sendQuest("@whi@say then no or yes ,else pm an Admin", 5982); //sendQuest("@whi@Thank-You , Derek", 14605);

Number 11 and 12 and moderator hilight

I removed the 1-10 and they are still there even tho they arn’t in the code…
If a regular user puts in a username and clicks on scamming or something they can mute people but only for 2 secs.

Anyway to fix to make all hilight?

Read full topic
